result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dontray Cornelius Turner

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed:  Notice of Unopposed Motion and Motion to Modify Bond Conditions.

Defendant Dontray Cornelius Turner not in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerald Kerska in court for Dontray Cornelius Turner.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense filed motions to suppress. Court set a motion hearing date.  Court ordered State to respond by 1-05-2023.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 9-20-22
Court rescheduled scheduling conference set for 9-16-2022 at 1:30 pm upon request from the defense.  Parties notified of new date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

Defendant Dontray Cornelius Turner not in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerald Kerska in court for Dontray Cornelius Turner.  Attorney Alexandria Carlson in court on behalf of Samuel E. Simpson for State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Court acknowledges requests for substitution which is approved. Defense requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned for a scheduling conference Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (13 pages) commencing 08-18-2022 by AMY DE LA ROSA.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 8-23-22
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Dontray Cornelius Turner in court with attorney Gerald Kerska.  Defendant Dontray Cornelius Turner in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Dontray Cornelius Turner appeared by video means with Attorney.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #13CF4103. Sworn for the State: MCSO Deputy J. Corrao. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Received and Filed: Attorney Gerald Kerska

Adjustment Number: 22A 076249,
Payable Number: 1024784,
Receipt Number: 22RP031817,
Amount: $20.00
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-8-22
Defense counsel contacted the clerk requesting prelim hearing be adjourned to new date. Parties notified via email of new court hearing. Case adjourned, Branch PE.

Defendant Dontray Cornelius Turner in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Indigency Hearing. Indigency Hearing proceeded. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Attorney Steve Kravit, in court via telephone, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning 9-1-2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Dontray Cornelius Turner in court in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered an oral no contact with A.A.B.

Defendant Dontray Cornelius Turner in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Dontray Cornelius Turner in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDNER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
